primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from human depletion and regret (the wine running out) to the abundance of God's salvation through Jesus Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus of Nazareth steps on the scene.
He has come to pour out his life for us.
He is the One... who is able to give purification.
The future blessings of the heavenly kingdom had become present.
A life that is built... by the Holy Spirit into a fellowship of love.
Jesus lives, not according to human arrangements, but according to God’s will.

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity / The Hearer / The Guests at the Wedding
tekstueel_bewijs: He sees us, he loves us, and he has come to pour out his life for us.

helper.identificatie: Mary (as model of faith) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: She makes a space for him to act.
Being built by the Holy Spirit into a fellowship of love.
helper.rol_van_god: God (Jesus) is the Subject; the Spirit is the internalizing Helper.

tekstueel_bewijs: The creeping chill of that feeling—'there should have been more to it all.'
The whole world full of disease and violence and cruelty and death.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a lack of wine, but the ontological 'undoing' of death and the failure of human rituals to cleanse sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of faith and service following the reception of grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A life of service to others and God's suffering world.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as a result of the primary program (soteriology).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Will → Abundant Life → The Hearer

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus of Nazareth steps on the scene.
He has come to pour out his life for us.
He goes to prepare a place for us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We take refuge in all sorts of escapes.
We buy something and charge it.
The servants... haul this huge amount of water.

voorbeelden: Whatever he tells you, do it.
What I really sought was something I had left behind.
Recognized that the future blessings... had become present.
The Son of God is powerful to save.
The only One who is able to give purification.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Inability' of man (lack of wine/failed rituals) and the 'Ability' (Pouvoir) of Christ to act where man cannot.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Regret) through ~S2 (Escapism) and ~S1 (Ineffective Ritual), finally resolved in S1 (Christ's Wine).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ transforms the water of ~S1 into the wine of S1, bypassing human effort.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and regret are described as 'undoing' and 'creeping chill'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions Jesus as the active Subject who provides what humans cannot produce. Human effort (rituals) is explicitly described as failing.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: She is, as always, the model of the true believer.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus of Nazareth steps on the scene. He sees our predicament.
Water from them is used for the washing away of sin. It is used, but it doesn’t work.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary is used as a model of faith, but her 'action' is specifically to step aside and make space for Jesus to act.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by focusing on Jesus' power over Mary's request.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-salvation; comfort in the face of regret.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is an outside-in event.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the human 'lack' to the divine 'abundance' is seamless and theologically grounded.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Son of God is powerful to save... the only One who is able to wipe away regret forever.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit builds the fellowship of love (Pouvoir-faire).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'catastrophe' and 'creeping chill'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative structure. Jesus is the undisputed Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for an Epiphany sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Regret) is already sufficiently heavy.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of moralism by identifying the 'water' of human effort as joyless and ineffective, pointing instead to the 'wine' of Christ's finished work.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the Edith Piaf and NY Review of Books anecdotes, semiotic analysis shows these function as the 'Opponent' (Regret/Lack) that only the 'Subject' (Jesus) can overcome.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the jars; semiotics identifies the jars as a failed 'Helper' in the axis of power.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'servants' are not the subjects of the miracle despite their physical labor; they are instrumental helpers to the true Subject, Jesus.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (steps, sees, hears, loves, comes, pours, gives, prepares)
We (take refuge, buy, drink, pop, grab, throw, read, climb)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses secular cultural references to establish the 'Lack' (Object of desire) before introducing the 'Sender' (God) and 'Subject' (Jesus).
